document_name_accent: ung thu bieu mo ong tuyen vu tai cho.json
document_title: Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS): Symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
It's unclear what causes DCIS. DCIS forms when genetic mutations occur in the DNA of milk duct cells. Genetic mutations cause the cells to appear abnormal, but the cells are not yet able to spread out of the milk ducts.
Researchers don't know exactly what causes the abnormal cell growth that leads to DCIS. Factors that may play a part include lifestyle, environment and genes inherited from your parents.
subsection_title: ung thu bieu mo ong tuyen vu tai cho.json. Causes of ductal carcinoma in situ
